oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A collective mark for Peruvian non-certified organic products: smallholder market differentiation and product development
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Quispe, Moisés
Van den Eeckhout, Hannes
Ugás, Roberto
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
Consumer issues
Produce chain management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In order to enhance the integration of non-certified smallholders into improved short value chains, the AGROECO Project supported the National Association of Ecological Farmers of Peru (ANPE PERU) to develop its “Frutos de la tierra” (Fruits of the earth) brand into a multi-product collective mark. The development process and bottlenecks are analyzed as well as suggestions presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Quispe, Moisés; Van den Eeckhout, Hannes and Ugás, Roberto (2014) A collective mark for Peruvian non-certified organic products: smallholder market differentiation and product development. Paper at: IFOAM Organic World Congress 2014, Istanbul, Turkey, 13-15 October 2014. [Completed]
